Five decades on, nobody can now dispute the legendary status of this lot! From Frank, Bob and Johnny in 1970 to Olivia, Debbie and Kate at the end of the decade.
From hippies to punk rockers, via folk, funk, soul & disco - these are the classic songs that made the 70s!
Pop Groups ruled the 70s and they came from all quarters! From Germany's Boney M, Sweden's Abba & America's Village People to the UK's Queen, Police & Showaddywaddy.
From hippies to punk rockers, via folk, funk, soul & disco - these are the classic songs that made the 70s!
Quite simply the biggest hits from the biggest pop act of the 70s - Abba. 12 songs, 7 UK number 1s.

programmes.show_name: 70s Stars - But Who Is The Oldest?
programmes.show_description: It's music's very own over-70s club, packed with superstars including Barry Gibb, Debbie Harry, and Bryan Ferry. But they're all youngsters next to the select bunch aged 80-plus!
Non-stop punk and new wave the cool kids were listening to in the latter half of the decade - expect skinny jeans, safety pins, guitars and a few snarls!
The 5 years from '77 to '81 was possibly the most exciting & vibrant time to be a teenager & Clare Grogan was there - buying the records, seeing the bands & wearing the t-shirts!
Feelgood hits from just 1 decade - the 1970s! Platform boots and flares at the ready?
Every song is fun, fabulous & feelgood! We challenge you not to pick up that hairbrush and sing your heart out with this ultimate 70s mixtape.

programmes.show_name: Pat Sharp's Bad Hair - Big Tunes!
programmes.show_description: The hairvolution of rock'n'roll - the good, the bad, and the ugly. Pat Sharp is back with a countdown of classic 70s songs accompanied by dodgy 70s hair-don'ts!
Non-stop 70s rock & guitar action - all night!
From the era of glam rock, new wave and disco, it's all the hits from just one decade - the 1970s! Platform boots and flares at the ready?
Tony's pulled out quite a list of pop pinups for two hours of indulgence. Bolan, Bowie, Cassidy, an Osmond, Abba girls, Rod, and ladies' men Barry White and Demis Roussos. Phwoar!
Tracks with big TV connections! Could be theme tunes, adverts or just a song made famous by a TV show.

Our most complete list yet of UK number 1s of the decade! Some songs just don't have videos, but 146 chart toppers do, and here they are - in order!
From the early days when soul gained that disco beat in 1973, to the turn of the decade when Blondie and Diana Ross got in on the act! Simon Bates is your dancefloor host!
